description: Lists the templates, if any, that are associated with a connector.

parameters.name: ConnectorArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that was returned when you called CreateConnector.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: Use this parameter when paginating results in a subsequent request after you receive a response with truncated results. Set it to the value of the NextToken parameter from the response you just received.

nested_items.name: Templates
nested_items.description: Custom configuration templates used when issuing a certificate.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that was returned when you called CreateTemplate.

nested_items.name: ConnectorArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that was returned when you called CreateConnector.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the template was created.

nested_items.name: Definition
nested_items.description: Template configuration to define the information included in certificates. Define certificate validity and renewal periods, certificate request handling and enrollment options, key usage extensions, application policies, and cryptography settings.

nested_items.name: TemplateV2
nested_items.description: Template configuration to define the information included in certificates. Define certificate validity and renewal periods, certificate request handling and enrollment options, key usage extensions, application policies, and cryptography settings.

nested_items.name: CertificateValidity
nested_items.description: Certificate validity describes the validity and renewal periods of a certificate.

nested_items.name: RenewalPeriod
nested_items.description: Renewal period is the period of time before certificate expiration when a new certificate will be requested.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: ValidityPeriod
nested_items.description: Information describing the end of the validity period of the certificate. This parameter sets the 'Not After' date for the certificate. Certificate validity is the period of time during which a certificate is valid. Validity can be expressed as an explicit date and time when the certificate expires, or as a span of time after issuance, stated in days, months, or years. For more information, see Validity in RFC 5280. This value is unaffected when ValidityNotBefore is also specified. For example, if Validity is set to 20 days in the future, the certificate will expire 20 days from issuance time regardless of the ValidityNotBefore value.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: EnrollmentFlags
nested_items.description: Enrollment flags describe the enrollment settings for certificates such as using the existing private key and deleting expired or revoked certificates.

nested_items.name: EnableKeyReuseOnNtTokenKeysetStorageFull
nested_items.description: Allow renewal using the same key.

nested_items.name: IncludeSymmetricAlgorithms
nested_items.description: Include symmetric algorithms allowed by the subject.

nested_items.name: NoSecurityExtension
nested_items.description: This flag instructs the CA to not include the security extension szOID_NTDS_CA_SECURITY_EXT (OID:1.3.6.1.4.1.311.25.2), as specified in [MS-WCCE] sections 2.2.2.7.7.4 and 3.2.2.6.2.1.4.5.9, in the issued certificate. This addresses a Windows Kerberos elevation-of-privilege vulnerability.

nested_items.name: RemoveInvalidCertificateFromPersonalStore
nested_items.description: Delete expired or revoked certificates instead of archiving them.

nested_items.name: UserInteractionRequired
nested_items.description: Require user interaction when the subject is enrolled and the private key associated with the certificate is used.

nested_items.name: Extensions
nested_items.description: Extensions describe the key usage extensions and application policies for a template.

nested_items.name: ApplicationPolicies
nested_items.description: Application policies specify what the certificate is used for and its purpose.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Marks the application policy extension as critical.

nested_items.name: Policies
nested_items.description: Application policies describe what the certificate can be used for.

nested_items.name: PolicyObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The object identifier (OID) of an application policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyType
nested_items.description: The type of application policy.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Sets the key usage extension to critical.

nested_items.name: UsageFlags
nested_items.description: The key usage flags represent the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature) of the key contained in the certificate.

nested_items.name: DataEncipherment
nested_items.description: DataEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for directly enciphering raw user data without the use of an intermediate symmetric cipher.

nested_items.name: DigitalSignature
nested_items.description: The digitalSignature is asserted when the subject public key is used for verifying digital signatures.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: KeyAgreement is asserted when the subject public key is used for key agreement.

nested_items.name: KeyEncipherment
nested_items.description: KeyEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for enciphering private or secret keys, i.e., for key transport.

nested_items.name: NonRepudiation
nested_items.description: NonRepudiation is asserted when the subject public key is used to verify digital signatures.

nested_items.name: GeneralFlags
nested_items.description: General flags describe whether the template is used for computers or users and if the template can be used with autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: AutoEnrollment
nested_items.description: Allows certificate issuance using autoenrollment. Set to TRUE to allow autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: MachineType
nested_items.description: Defines if the template is for machines or users. Set to TRUE if the template is for machines. Set to FALSE if the template is for users.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Private key attributes allow you to specify the minimal key length, key spec, and cryptographic providers for the private key of a certificate for v2 templates. V2 templates allow you to use Legacy Cryptographic Service Providers.

nested_items.name: CryptoProviders
nested_items.description: Defines the cryptographic providers used to generate the private key.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KeySpec
nested_items.description: Defines the purpose of the private key. Set it to 'KEY_EXCHANGE' or 'SIGNATURE' value.

nested_items.name: MinimalKeyLength
nested_items.description: Set the minimum key length of the private key.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyFlags
nested_items.description: Private key flags for v2 templates specify the client compatibility, if the private key can be exported, and if user input is required when using a private key.

nested_items.name: ClientVersion
nested_items.description: Defines the minimum client compatibility.

nested_items.name: ExportableKey
nested_items.description: Allows the private key to be exported.

nested_items.name: StrongKeyProtectionRequired
nested_items.description: Require user input when using the private key for enrollment.

nested_items.name: SubjectNameFlags
nested_items.description: Subject name flags describe the subject name and subject alternate name that is included in a certificate.

nested_items.name: RequireCommonName
nested_items.description: Include the common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDirectoryPath
nested_items.description: Include the directory path in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDnsAsCn
nested_items.description: Include the DNS as common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDirectoryGuid
nested_items.description: Include the globally unique identifier (GUID) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDns
nested_items.description: Include the DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDomainDns
nested_items.description: Include the domain DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireSpn
nested_items.description: Include the service principal name (SPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireUpn
nested_items.description: Include the user principal name (UPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SupersededTemplates
nested_items.description: List of templates in Active Directory that are superseded by this template.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TemplateV3
nested_items.description: Template configuration to define the information included in certificates. Define certificate validity and renewal periods, certificate request handling and enrollment options, key usage extensions, application policies, and cryptography settings.

nested_items.name: CertificateValidity
nested_items.description: Certificate validity describes the validity and renewal periods of a certificate.

nested_items.name: RenewalPeriod
nested_items.description: Renewal period is the period of time before certificate expiration when a new certificate will be requested.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: ValidityPeriod
nested_items.description: Information describing the end of the validity period of the certificate. This parameter sets the 'Not After' date for the certificate. Certificate validity is the period of time during which a certificate is valid. Validity can be expressed as an explicit date and time when the certificate expires, or as a span of time after issuance, stated in days, months, or years. For more information, see Validity in RFC 5280. This value is unaffected when ValidityNotBefore is also specified. For example, if Validity is set to 20 days in the future, the certificate will expire 20 days from issuance time regardless of the ValidityNotBefore value.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: EnrollmentFlags
nested_items.description: Enrollment flags describe the enrollment settings for certificates such as using the existing private key and deleting expired or revoked certificates.

nested_items.name: EnableKeyReuseOnNtTokenKeysetStorageFull
nested_items.description: Allow renewal using the same key.

nested_items.name: IncludeSymmetricAlgorithms
nested_items.description: Include symmetric algorithms allowed by the subject.

nested_items.name: NoSecurityExtension
nested_items.description: This flag instructs the CA to not include the security extension szOID_NTDS_CA_SECURITY_EXT (OID:1.3.6.1.4.1.311.25.2), as specified in [MS-WCCE] sections 2.2.2.7.7.4 and 3.2.2.6.2.1.4.5.9, in the issued certificate. This addresses a Windows Kerberos elevation-of-privilege vulnerability.

nested_items.name: RemoveInvalidCertificateFromPersonalStore
nested_items.description: Delete expired or revoked certificates instead of archiving them.

nested_items.name: UserInteractionRequired
nested_items.description: Require user interaction when the subject is enrolled and the private key associated with the certificate is used.

nested_items.name: Extensions
nested_items.description: Extensions describe the key usage extensions and application policies for a template.

nested_items.name: ApplicationPolicies
nested_items.description: Application policies specify what the certificate is used for and its purpose.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Marks the application policy extension as critical.

nested_items.name: Policies
nested_items.description: Application policies describe what the certificate can be used for.

nested_items.name: PolicyObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The object identifier (OID) of an application policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyType
nested_items.description: The type of application policy.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Sets the key usage extension to critical.

nested_items.name: UsageFlags
nested_items.description: The key usage flags represent the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature) of the key contained in the certificate.

nested_items.name: DataEncipherment
nested_items.description: DataEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for directly enciphering raw user data without the use of an intermediate symmetric cipher.

nested_items.name: DigitalSignature
nested_items.description: The digitalSignature is asserted when the subject public key is used for verifying digital signatures.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: KeyAgreement is asserted when the subject public key is used for key agreement.

nested_items.name: KeyEncipherment
nested_items.description: KeyEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for enciphering private or secret keys, i.e., for key transport.

nested_items.name: NonRepudiation
nested_items.description: NonRepudiation is asserted when the subject public key is used to verify digital signatures.

nested_items.name: GeneralFlags
nested_items.description: General flags describe whether the template is used for computers or users and if the template can be used with autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: AutoEnrollment
nested_items.description: Allows certificate issuance using autoenrollment. Set to TRUE to allow autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: MachineType
nested_items.description: Defines if the template is for machines or users. Set to TRUE if the template is for machines. Set to FALSE if the template is for users.

nested_items.name: HashAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Specifies the hash algorithm used to hash the private key.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Private key attributes allow you to specify the algorithm, minimal key length, key spec, key usage, and cryptographic providers for the private key of a certificate for v3 templates. V3 templates allow you to use Key Storage Providers.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: Defines the algorithm used to generate the private key.

nested_items.name: CryptoProviders
nested_items.description: Defines the cryptographic providers used to generate the private key.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KeySpec
nested_items.description: Defines the purpose of the private key. Set it to 'KEY_EXCHANGE' or 'SIGNATURE' value.

nested_items.name: KeyUsageProperty
nested_items.description: The key usage property defines the purpose of the private key contained in the certificate. You can specify specific purposes using property flags or all by using property type ALL.

nested_items.name: PropertyFlags
nested_items.description: You can specify key usage for encryption, key agreement, and signature. You can use property flags or property type but not both.

nested_items.name: Decrypt
nested_items.description: Allows key for encryption and decryption.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: Allows key exchange without encryption.

nested_items.name: Sign
nested_items.description: Allow key use for digital signature.

nested_items.name: PropertyType
nested_items.description: You can specify all key usages using property type ALL. You can use property type or property flags but not both.

nested_items.name: MinimalKeyLength
nested_items.description: Set the minimum key length of the private key.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyFlags
nested_items.description: Private key flags for v3 templates specify the client compatibility, if the private key can be exported, if user input is required when using a private key, and if an alternate signature algorithm should be used.

nested_items.name: ClientVersion
nested_items.description: Defines the minimum client compatibility.

nested_items.name: ExportableKey
nested_items.description: Allows the private key to be exported.

nested_items.name: RequireAlternateSignatureAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Reguires the PKCS #1 v2.1 signature format for certificates. You should verify that your CA, objects, and applications can accept this signature format.

nested_items.name: StrongKeyProtectionRequired
nested_items.description: Requirer user input when using the private key for enrollment.

nested_items.name: SubjectNameFlags
nested_items.description: Subject name flags describe the subject name and subject alternate name that is included in a certificate.

nested_items.name: RequireCommonName
nested_items.description: Include the common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDirectoryPath
nested_items.description: Include the directory path in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDnsAsCn
nested_items.description: Include the DNS as common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDirectoryGuid
nested_items.description: Include the globally unique identifier (GUID) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDns
nested_items.description: Include the DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDomainDns
nested_items.description: Include the domain DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireSpn
nested_items.description: Include the service principal name (SPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireUpn
nested_items.description: Include the user principal name (UPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SupersededTemplates
nested_items.description: List of templates in Active Directory that are superseded by this template.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TemplateV4
nested_items.description: Template configuration to define the information included in certificates. Define certificate validity and renewal periods, certificate request handling and enrollment options, key usage extensions, application policies, and cryptography settings.

nested_items.name: CertificateValidity
nested_items.description: Certificate validity describes the validity and renewal periods of a certificate.

nested_items.name: RenewalPeriod
nested_items.description: Renewal period is the period of time before certificate expiration when a new certificate will be requested.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: ValidityPeriod
nested_items.description: Information describing the end of the validity period of the certificate. This parameter sets the 'Not After' date for the certificate. Certificate validity is the period of time during which a certificate is valid. Validity can be expressed as an explicit date and time when the certificate expires, or as a span of time after issuance, stated in days, months, or years. For more information, see Validity in RFC 5280. This value is unaffected when ValidityNotBefore is also specified. For example, if Validity is set to 20 days in the future, the certificate will expire 20 days from issuance time regardless of the ValidityNotBefore value.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The numeric value for the validity period.

nested_items.name: PeriodType
nested_items.description: The unit of time. You can select hours, days, weeks, months, and years.

nested_items.name: EnrollmentFlags
nested_items.description: Enrollment flags describe the enrollment settings for certificates using the existing private key and deleting expired or revoked certificates.

nested_items.name: EnableKeyReuseOnNtTokenKeysetStorageFull
nested_items.description: Allow renewal using the same key.

nested_items.name: IncludeSymmetricAlgorithms
nested_items.description: Include symmetric algorithms allowed by the subject.

nested_items.name: NoSecurityExtension
nested_items.description: This flag instructs the CA to not include the security extension szOID_NTDS_CA_SECURITY_EXT (OID:1.3.6.1.4.1.311.25.2), as specified in [MS-WCCE] sections 2.2.2.7.7.4 and 3.2.2.6.2.1.4.5.9, in the issued certificate. This addresses a Windows Kerberos elevation-of-privilege vulnerability.

nested_items.name: RemoveInvalidCertificateFromPersonalStore
nested_items.description: Delete expired or revoked certificates instead of archiving them.

nested_items.name: UserInteractionRequired
nested_items.description: Require user interaction when the subject is enrolled and the private key associated with the certificate is used.

nested_items.name: Extensions
nested_items.description: Extensions describe the key usage extensions and application policies for a template.

nested_items.name: ApplicationPolicies
nested_items.description: Application policies specify what the certificate is used for and its purpose.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Marks the application policy extension as critical.

nested_items.name: Policies
nested_items.description: Application policies describe what the certificate can be used for.

nested_items.name: PolicyObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The object identifier (OID) of an application policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyType
nested_items.description: The type of application policy.

nested_items.name: Critical
nested_items.description: Sets the key usage extension to critical.

nested_items.name: UsageFlags
nested_items.description: The key usage flags represent the purpose (e.g., encipherment, signature) of the key contained in the certificate.

nested_items.name: DataEncipherment
nested_items.description: DataEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for directly enciphering raw user data without the use of an intermediate symmetric cipher.

nested_items.name: DigitalSignature
nested_items.description: The digitalSignature is asserted when the subject public key is used for verifying digital signatures.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: KeyAgreement is asserted when the subject public key is used for key agreement.

nested_items.name: KeyEncipherment
nested_items.description: KeyEncipherment is asserted when the subject public key is used for enciphering private or secret keys, i.e., for key transport.

nested_items.name: NonRepudiation
nested_items.description: NonRepudiation is asserted when the subject public key is used to verify digital signatures.

nested_items.name: GeneralFlags
nested_items.description: General flags describe whether the template is used for computers or users and if the template can be used with autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: AutoEnrollment
nested_items.description: Allows certificate issuance using autoenrollment. Set to TRUE to allow autoenrollment.

nested_items.name: MachineType
nested_items.description: Defines if the template is for machines or users. Set to TRUE if the template is for machines. Set to FALSE if the template is for users.

nested_items.name: HashAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Specifies the hash algorithm used to hash the private key. Hash algorithm can only be specified when using Key Storage Providers.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyAttributes
nested_items.description: Private key attributes allow you to specify the minimal key length, key spec, key usage, and cryptographic providers for the private key of a certificate for v4 templates. V4 templates allow you to use either Key Storage Providers or Legacy Cryptographic Service Providers. You specify the cryptography provider category in private key flags.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: Defines the algorithm used to generate the private key.

nested_items.name: CryptoProviders
nested_items.description: Defines the cryptographic providers used to generate the private key.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KeySpec
nested_items.description: Defines the purpose of the private key. Set it to 'KEY_EXCHANGE' or 'SIGNATURE' value.

nested_items.name: KeyUsageProperty
nested_items.description: The key usage property defines the purpose of the private key contained in the certificate. You can specify specific purposes using property flags or all by using property type ALL.

nested_items.name: PropertyFlags
nested_items.description: You can specify key usage for encryption, key agreement, and signature. You can use property flags or property type but not both.

nested_items.name: Decrypt
nested_items.description: Allows key for encryption and decryption.

nested_items.name: KeyAgreement
nested_items.description: Allows key exchange without encryption.

nested_items.name: Sign
nested_items.description: Allow key use for digital signature.

nested_items.name: PropertyType
nested_items.description: You can specify all key usages using property type ALL. You can use property type or property flags but not both.

nested_items.name: MinimalKeyLength
nested_items.description: Set the minimum key length of the private key.

nested_items.name: PrivateKeyFlags
nested_items.description: Private key flags for v4 templates specify the client compatibility, if the private key can be exported, if user input is required when using a private key, if an alternate signature algorithm should be used, and if certificates are renewed using the same private key.

nested_items.name: ClientVersion
nested_items.description: Defines the minimum client compatibility.

nested_items.name: ExportableKey
nested_items.description: Allows the private key to be exported.

nested_items.name: RequireAlternateSignatureAlgorithm
nested_items.description: Requires the PKCS #1 v2.1 signature format for certificates. You should verify that your CA, objects, and applications can accept this signature format.

nested_items.name: RequireSameKeyRenewal
nested_items.description: Renew certificate using the same private key.

nested_items.name: StrongKeyProtectionRequired
nested_items.description: Require user input when using the private key for enrollment.

nested_items.name: UseLegacyProvider
nested_items.description: Specifies the cryptographic service provider category used to generate private keys. Set to TRUE to use Legacy Cryptographic Service Providers and FALSE to use Key Storage Providers.

nested_items.name: SubjectNameFlags
nested_items.description: Subject name flags describe the subject name and subject alternate name that is included in a certificate.

nested_items.name: RequireCommonName
nested_items.description: Include the common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDirectoryPath
nested_items.description: Include the directory path in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireDnsAsCn
nested_items.description: Include the DNS as common name in the subject name.

nested_items.name: RequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDirectoryGuid
nested_items.description: Include the globally unique identifier (GUID) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDns
nested_items.description: Include the DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireDomainDns
nested_items.description: Include the domain DNS in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireEmail
nested_items.description: Include the subject's email in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireSpn
nested_items.description: Include the service principal name (SPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SanRequireUpn
nested_items.description: Include the user principal name (UPN) in the subject alternate name.

nested_items.name: SupersededTemplates
nested_items.description: List of templates in Active Directory that are superseded by this template.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of the template. The template name must be unique.

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: Object identifier of a template.

nested_items.name: PolicySchema
nested_items.description: The template schema version. Template schema versions can be v2, v3, or v4. The template configuration options change based on the template schema version.

nested_items.name: MajorRevision
nested_items.description: The revision version of the template. Re-enrolling all certificate holders will increment the major revision.

nested_items.name: MinorRevision
nested_items.description: The revision version of the template. Re-enrolling all certificate holders will increment the major revision.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Status of the template. Status can be creating, active, deleting, or failed.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time that the template was updated.
